metadata.Title: CVE-2020-14310 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - high.
metadata.Description: There is an issue on grub2 before version 2.06 at function read_section_as_string(). It expects a font name to be at max UINT32_MAX - 1 length in bytes but it doesn't verify it before proceed with buffer allocation to read the value from the font value. An attacker may leverage that by crafting a malicious font file which has a name with UINT32_MAX, leading to read_section_as_string() to an arithmetic overflow, zero-sized allocation and further heap-based buffer overflow. Chris Coulson discovered that multiple integer overflows existed in GRUB2 when handling certain filesystems or font files, leading to heap-based buffer overflows. A local attacker could use these to execute arbitrary code and bypass UEFI Secure Boot restrictions.

notes.Note: alexmurray> grub2-signed is not supported in Ubuntu 12.04 ESM (precise/esm) and so marking the priority for grub2 in this release as low

criterions.comment: grub2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
grub2-signed: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
